poem:
Title: "In the Hush of Lisbon Mornings"

Upon the cobblestone-hushed mornings of Lisbon,
Where shadows dance to fado's sighs,
Luis Montenegro keenly listens,
Under the cathedral of Portuguese skies.

By the presidential palace he'll tread,
Summoned in the thick of the night,
Between dreams of a future to be led,
Awake, under democracy's quiet might.

In a thin victory, found not in might,
But in the hopeful whispers of dawn's first light.
